title: Tributes and Support for James Van Der Beek After His Death
summary: James Van Der Beek, best known for his role as Dawson Leery on the TV series Dawson's Creek, passed away at age 48 due to bowel cancer. His death has prompted heartfelt tributes from co-stars and celebrities on social media. Katie Holmes, who played Joey Potter on the show, posted a handwritten statement on Instagram praising Van Der Beek's bravery, compassion, and strength. Busy Philipps, another co-star, expressed deep sadness and shared memories of their friendship, while also promoting an online fundraiser to assist Van Der Beek's widow, Kimberley, and their six children. The GoFundMe campaign quickly raised over $1.2 million to cover medical expenses and other costs. Reese Witherspoon and Mary-Margaret Humes also shared condolences, highlighting Van Der Beek's talent and kindness. Van Der Beek was diagnosed with cancer in late 2023 and publicly revealed it in November 2024. His career included roles in shows like Varsity Blues, but he remained most iconic for Dawson's Creek, which aired from 1998 to 2003. The tributes emphasize his impact on those who knew him and call for privacy for his grieving family.

background_read: James Van Der Beek was an American actor who rose to fame in the late 1990s for his role as Dawson Leery on the teen drama Dawson's Creek, which became a cultural phenomenon. The show aired from 1998 to 2003 and helped launch the careers of several young actors. Van Der Beek also appeared in films like Varsity Blues and had roles in other TV series. In 2023, he was diagnosed with bowel cancer, a disease that affects the digestive system and can be life-threatening. He shared his diagnosis publicly in 2024, raising awareness about cancer. After his death, the entertainment community and fans mourned his loss, with co-stars using social media to share personal memories and organize financial support for his family through crowdfunding platforms like GoFundMe.
